supporting_text: The NAP emphasizes a multi-sectoral systems approach and acknowledges that the health of humans is directly linked to the health of animals and the environment.
Objective 4: Optimize the use of antimicrobial medicines in human and animal health.
Objective 4: Optimize the use of antimicrobial medicines in human and animal health.
The NAP includes actions related to environmental health and the management of waste and water.
The NAP includes actions to eliminate the use of medically-important antibiotics for growth promotion in food animals.
The NAP outlines the establishment of a national entity with the ability to systematically collect, analyze, and report data on AMR.
The NAP includes national targets to combat antibiotic-resistant bacteria with specific timelines.
The NAP specifies targets such as stabilizing and demonstrating a yearly decline in the incidence of various resistant infections.
The document does not specify budget allocations for the strategies.
The document does not contain an assessment of future budget requirements.
The NAP mentions the establishment of the National Antimicrobial Oversight Committee.
The NAP includes actions to develop and enforce legislation and regulations on prescribing and dispensing of antimicrobials.
The NAP includes objectives to improve awareness and understanding of antimicrobial resistance through effective communication, education, and training.
The NAP includes a national public education campaign regarding the use of antimicrobial drugs and issues of antimicrobial resistance.
The NAP includes activities to work with WHO, FAO, OIE, and other multinational organizations to enhance global capacity to combat AMR.
The NAP includes the establishment of a national AMR surveillance system.
The NAP emphasizes the need for improved management and surveillance of antimicrobial resistance.
The NAP includes objectives to reduce the incidence of infection through effective sanitation, hygiene, and infection prevention measures.
The NAP aligns with the Global Action Plan for Antimicrobial Resistance which includes international standards.
The NAP includes actions to develop and enforce guidelines regarding the distribution and prescription of antimicrobials.
The NAP includes actions to regulate the use of antibiotics in both human and animal health.
The NAP includes objectives to develop international collaborations for research on AMR.
